content.description: Begin in tight dihedral or pull jugs just to the left  of it. After the end of the short crack follow slopey chicken heads using horizontals for protection.
content.location: Left around the corner from Baxter. Starts with the leaning crack in a small cave.

content.description: Head up easy terrain directly under the orange mini roof.  Pull over the roof and cruise up to the anchors just left of the main line. Gear is tricky at the crux and hard to find above the roof.  It's easier terrain up there so you can just run it out to the anchors.
content.protection: Cams up to #1 and a set of stoppers. Bolted anchors
content.location: Starts in the middle of  the wall directly under the small but obvious orange roof.

content.description: Climbs a dihedral that angles left, then half-way up switch to angling back right until it comes under a bulge. The bulge is the crux, but there are giant jugs on top.
content.protection: Tree anchor, which sits a way back from the edge.

content.description: Start up the route just above the really low roof and follow the path of least resistance, slinging chicken heads as you go for protection.  There are a few horizontals that accept smaller cams.  Top out and sling a large boulder for an anchor.  There is a nice big tree about 20 feet left to rap from.
content.protection: Small cams up to a #2 and slings for chicken heads.  Large cordelette to sling a boulder or tree for an anchor.  Rap off a tree.
content.location: Starts just before the low roof intersects with the ground on the left side of this wall.

content.description: West facing so it gets good afternoon sun.  It is home to a several moderate trad routes and is located between The Point and Heart Chamber
